page.title: 14DEWSNAP SIDINGS DUKINFIELD
page.content: The railway sidings were originally known as{Dog Lane {Sidings.As Dukinfield became more {important the sidings were extended {until they covered the old Astley Deep {Pit}.As old industries declined so did the railways and the sidings became disused.Once there were four railway stations in Dukinfield- now there is only one line and there are no stations. Some of the old rusty tracks in the sidings have been taken up now and the rest are full of weeds.Children often play there-though they shouldn't- and they often hide in the few old sheds still left up.Some of them even go up there to try glue-sniffing.The old carriage works is now used by a timber firm.
